title: The Gaming Shelf Deals a New Deck of Cards
description:
As the temperature drops, now becomes the perfect time to start hosting more game nights. Maybe start up that new campaign you’ve been thinking about. Whether you’re a forever DM or have never DM’d before, we’ve got some great games that are sure to challenge you and delight all your players.

title: Android's Next Flagship Processor is Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 2
description:
Qualcomm has announced its second-generation flagship mobile chip. The Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 will be available in various flagship Android devices as soon as the end of 2022.

Read more...

title: Willow Returns in a New Clip From the Disney+ Show
description:
Willow returns on November 30 and a new clip shows you exactly how it happens.

Read more...

title: Google Investor Thinks Google Should Be More Like Twitter
description:
Google’s parent company, Alphabet Inc, was told it needed to make aggressive cost-cutting moves after receiving a letter from activist hedge fund TCI Fund Management.

Read more...

title: Another Crypto Company Is Going Broke Because of FTX
description:
FTX, the bankrupt crypto exchange that mismanaged customer funds and can’t account for billions in assets, is currently imploding like a dying sun and unfurling a wave of destruction that swallows everything in its path. That catastrophe may soon claim a new victim: BlockFi, one of the most well-known decentralized…

title: A Solar Sail Spacecraft Is About to Come Down Through Earth's Atmosphere in a Fiery Flame
description:
A tiny spacecraft is about to sail into its demise, burning up as it reenters Earth’s atmosphere for the end of its mission.

title: The Best Ways to Get High if You’re Rich
description:
Is this a product review or a fever dream? For reasons that will become abundantly clear shortly, I’m not sure. But what I do know is that this post is for rich people ONLY. Poor friends, middle-class pals: Avert your non-rich eyes! You cannot afford to read this article. As a freelancer journalist, neither can I,…

title: DoorDash Says Delivery Workers Can Now Block Problem Customers and Cancel Rude Peoples' Orders
description:
DoorDash, the online food ordering courier, announced a suite of worker-safety-focused features on Monday. The changes include a new ability for delivery workers to block customers who make them feel unsafe, cancel an order if a customer is rude in a text or call, plus other shifts to the DoorDash app, as the company…

Read more...

title: Surprisingly Earth-Like Clouds Spotted on Mars
description:
Two cameras on the Mars Express orbiter captured images of a series of dust storms near the Martian North Pole in 2019. Analysis of the images indicates that big clouds of dust on Mars formed similarly to water vapor clouds on Earth—an unintuitive finding, given how different the planets are.

Read more...

title: Doctor Who's New Era Will Redesign the Daleks (Again)
description:
Doctor Who’s Daleks have undergone a few makeovers since they were turned into bronzed machines of extermination in the 2005 revival of the show. And now, they’re apparently ready for another one—but just how much of an overhaul they’ll get remains to be seen.

Read more...

title: Netflix Lets You Boot Profiles From Your Account Ahead of Password Sharing Crackdown
description:
Netflix says it knows you’ll be traveling around this holiday season, so just in case you loaded your account on your distant uncle’s TV and forgot to sign out, you can now log them off manually. You know, in case there’s somebody like an ex accessing your account you don’t want to. Or, perhaps, there might be changes…

Read more...

title: Dungeons & Dragons & Novels: Revisiting Homeland
description:
After the success of The Icewind Dale trilogy and the immense popularity of its breakout star, Drizzt Do’Urden, R.A. Salvatore was inevitably going to explore how the one non-evil drow elf in the Forgotten Realms became… well, non-evil. The result was the Dark Elf trilogy, which began with Homeland. It was by far my…

Read more...

title: Subway's Pre-Made Sandwich AI Fridge Can Hear You
description:
In the newest chapter of fast food franchises stepping into the future, Subway’s new grab-and-go smart fridge tech has rolled out on a college campus in California this fall. Customers can grab sandwiches as they wish from the fridge, which is also listening to what you’re saying as you’re using it.

Read more...

title: Mastodon Has Officially Retired the 'Toot,' Its Version of the Tweet
description:
To the chagrin of many Mastodon users, the software’s developer has decided to formally retire the word “toot,” a term long used to describe posts on the decentralized social media service.

Read more...

title: Al Gore’s New Tool Can Zoom in on the Biggest Polluters in Your Town
description:
If you’ve ever wondered how much methane the landfill in your neighborhood emits, there’s now a way to potentially find out. A promising new tool can zoom in on spots around the world in various industries to measure just how much greenhouse gases those locations and facilities are emitting.

Read more...

title: Future DC Films Will Be More Focused, With Less Batman
description:
It’s true. The hierarchy of power in the DC universe is about to change. But it won’t be Black Adam doing the changing—it’s Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav. At a recent event, he described the future of DC Films as more focused and singular than it had been in the past. “There’s not going to be four Batmans,”…

title: How Lego and MIT Came Together To Give Us Lego Robots
description:
Pour one out for Mindstorms. The build-it-yourself Lego robotics brand is getting discontinued at the end of next year, but that doesn’t mean it won’t forever live on in our hearts. But it almost didn’t happen. In his book The Lego Story, Jens Andersen writes about the toy company’s growth from making wooden ducks to…

title: This Nostalgic Toy Auction Will Make You Wish All Your Childhood Toys Were Still Mint in the Box
description:
Fueled by morning cartoons that were nothing more than thinly veiled commercials, the 1980s were arguably the golden era of toys, with iconic lines like Transformers, G.I. Joe, and the Masters of the Universe debuting that are still popular today—and maybe even moreso, based on a toy-filled auction that ends tomorrow.

Read more...

title: After Unfurling Its Massive Array, Commercial Satellite Becomes as Bright as Orion's Stars
description:
Since its launch in September, the BlueWalker 3 satellite has had anxious observers watching the skies in anticipation of its full deployment. Now, the prototype satellite has fully stretched out its massive array of antennas, significantly increasing its brightness and posing a threat to astronomers’ views of the…

title: Chainsaw Man Dub Clip Introduces Power as the World's Worst Roommate
description:
In the world of Chainsaw Man, Tastuki Fujimoto’s smash hit manga—and now even smashier hit anime—perpetually miserable boy hero turned devil-hunter Denji thinks he’s found the dream life when he gets recruited into the government’s anti-devil Public Safety Division. But he’s about to find out that nothing is easy with…

title: Elon Musk Is Firing Twitter Employees Criticizing Him in Slack
description:
Twitter owner Elon Musk can add another title to his already long list: Big Brother. On Tuesday, the social media boss showed his employees that he was always watching what they were saying on Twitter’s internal channels, especially if they were talking smack about him.

Read more...

title: Fyre Festival's Billy McFarland Apologizes to the Bahamas Ahead of New Scheme
description:
Fyre Festival mastermind Billy McFarland is offering an olive branch to the Bahamas, the country where the disaster of a music festival kinda sorta took place in 2017.

title: World's Population Reaches 8 Billion People for the First Time—and That's Fine!
description:
Sometime today, November 15, the 8 billionth human on Earth is projected to be born. It could be happening right now, as I write this (or you read this). Or maybe it happened hours ago. But regardless of the exact second, today we officially enter a world with an estimated 8 billion people in it, according to a new…

title: How to Watch the Inaugural Launch of NASA’s SLS Megarocket
description:
The Artemis era appears to be at hand. After 12 years of anticipation, two scrubs, and two hurricanes, NASA’s 322-foot-tall (98-meter) SLS rocket is finally ready to take flight. You can watch the action live right here.

title: Taylor Swift's Tour Presale Breaks Ticketmaster
description:
The presale for Taylor Swift’s “The Eras Tour” has officially broken Ticketmaster. The singer’s sixth concert tour—her first since 2018—has seen increased demand coming off the record-breaking release of her album Midnights.

title: Apple AirPods Can Work as More Affordable Hearing Aids, Study Finds
description:
It’s estimated that by the year 2060, the number of Americans dealing with hearing loss will double, which is especially concerning because currently only about 25% of older adults who would benefit from a hearing aid actually have access to or are willing to use the expensive hardware. They’re not a perfect…

title: In This Look Inside Monarch, the Forecast Is First Contact
description:
Good news, bad news in the world of Image Comics’ new horror/sci-fi series Monarch: things are looking cloudy with a chance of devastating alien invasion.

title: Northwestern's Business School Will Waive Standardized Test Scores for Laid Off Tech Workers
description:
The growing number of tech workers who’ve lost their jobs so far this year amid a historic industry wide downturn may have a new lifeline: going back to school.

title: Vast Majority of People Who Invest in Bitcoin Inevitably Lose Money, Study Shows
description:
Around three quarters of newfound bitcoin investors have lost money when putting their funds into the great crypto game, according to new research from one of the world’s leading central bank institutions.

Read more...

title: Every Canceled (or Re-Worked) Disney Star Wars Project
description:
Last month marked the 10-year anniversary of one of the biggest pop culture moments of our lifetime: when the Walt Disney Company purchased Lucasfilm for $4 billion. Instantly, Star Wars was back in a big, big way and the past decade has been all but dominated by it.

title: Clippy Takes Starring Role on Microsoft's 2022 Ugly Holiday Sweater
description:
‘Tis the season to deck the halls, fa-the-la, and find the ugliest festive sweater possible for parties and get-togethers. As with years past, Microsoft is here to make that hunt a lot easier with its annual Windows Ugly Sweater, which this year features the original smart(ish) assistant: Clippy (technically Clippit—…

title: Netflix's Narnia Adaptations May Have Found a Surprising Director
description:
David Harbour keeps hyping up the Thunderbolts movie. Ross Duffer teases Stranger Things’ final season as a return to the first. Plus, a new look at the return of His Dark Materials, and what’s coming on The Mayfair Witches. Spoilers get!

title: The Massive Five-Foot Tall Eiffel Tower Is the Tallest Lego Set of All Time
description:
Grab your berets and croissants, because today Lego revealed a stunning tribute to France’s most iconic landmark, the Eiffel Tower. The real thing towers 1,083-feet over Paris, and while Lego’s recreation isn’t quite so massive, at 59-inches from its base to the French flag flying atop it, it’s the tallest Lego set to…

title: Why Are There so Many Lasers in James Bond Movies?
description:
Half the appeal of James Bond movies are the action sequences—dramatic gunfights, daring car chases, the final showdowns that dismantle the villain’s masterfully laid plans for world domination at the last minute. The other half are the gadgets—watches that deploy circular saws, Aston Martins with machine guns behind…

title: What It's Like to Use Apple's Emergency SOS Feature
description:
Apple’s Emergency SOS service has officially launched in the U.S. and Canada for the iPhone 14 and iPhone 14 Pro. Emergency SOS is a new feature that connects you with emergency services using a satellite connection rather than cellular or wifi so that you can call for help even in rural places.

Read more...

title: New York Times Runs Bizarre Softball Article on FTX's Sam Bankman-Fried
description:
FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday, leaving reasonable people to wonder how a cryptocurrency platform founded in 2019, which reached a valuation of $32 billion in 2021, could plummet to zero in such a short time. There’s a new piece in the New York Times which gained exclusive access to FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried,…

description:

title: Why Interview With the Vampire's Finale Didn't Stick to the Book
description:
As fans of Anne Rice’s Interview With the Vampire know, when Louis and Claudia first attempt to murder Lestat in the books, it’s a much less gory affair than the AMC series—which just released its season one finale—might lead you to believe.
